Body: Possible Duplicate:  Turning on Wi-Fi on demand  I can only find 3 options under Settings->Wi-Fi->Advanced->Keep Wi-Fi on during sleep:Always ((the default value))Only when plugged inNever (increases data usage)I feel like there's missing a 4th option, "On-demand". I want it to use Wi-Fi when needed (if possible), but I don't necessarily want Wi-Fi enabled all the time. It feels like my battery life suffer when running with the "Always" option.Is there a way for Android to use Wi-Fi on-demand when it's needed during sleep?If relevant, I'm running stock Android 4.2.1 on an LG Nexus 4.
Title: On-demand WiFi during sleep

history.Text: I can only find 3 options under `Settings->Wi-Fi->Advanced->Keep Wi-Fi on during sleep`:- Always ((the default value))- Only when plugged in- Never (increases data usage)I feel like there's missing a 4th option, "On-demand". I want it to use Wi-Fi when needed (if possible), but I don't necessarily want Wi-Fi enabled all the time. I've noticed my battery life suffering when running with the "Always" option.Is there a way for Android to use Wi-Fi on-demand when it's needed during sleep?If relevant, I'm running stock Android 4.2.1 on an LG Nexus 4.
